title: Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown Review - The Final Verdict
description:
On top of going back to the series’ 2D sidescrolling roots, The Lost Crown also radically reinvents and reinvigorates the franchise by adopting an intriguing structure, which proves to be one of its biggest strengths. 

Combined with similarly excellent combat, platforming, exploration, visual design, and more, it comes out as nothing short of a staggering accomplishment. Not only is The Lost Crown one of the best platformer in recent memory, it’s also slated to be among the best games of 2024.

title: The Full Story of Jin Kazama – Before You Play Tekken 8
description:
At the time of Tekken's inception, Jin Kazama as a character didn't even exist, but ever since his introduction in Tekken 3, he has become not only one of the series' most pivotal characters, but even its primary protagonist. 

After having taken a bit of a backseat in Tekken 7, Jin is once again set to take the hotseat at Tekken 8's main man, and ahead of the fighter's imminent launch, here, we're going to go over everything that you should know about Jin's story and his history.

title: 30 Graphically MIND-BLOWING Games of 2024 And Beyond
description:
As years go on and more powerful hardware is released, the demand for better graphics increases. While many developers are taking advantage of the raw power available, there are those on a completely different level and delivering stunning visuals unlike anything seen before.

Last year is especially noteworthy for this, and that trend looks to continue in 2024. Whether it's exclusives like Senua's Saga: Hellblade 2, Death Stranding 2, Silent Hill 2 and S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart of Chornobyl or multiplatform games like Tekken 8 and Black Myth: Wukong, graphics enthusiasts have plenty to look forward.

Check out 30 of the most graphically intensive titles coming this year that certain to leave a mark on the industry with their fidelity.
